intro: Philibertella torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's filbert, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and woodland settings. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
